1 Corinthians__04.1: Let a man so account of us as of the ministers of Christ, and the dispensers of the mysteries of God.
1 Corinthians__04.2: Here now it is required among the dispensers, that a man be found faithful.
1 Corinthians__04.3: But to me it is a very small thing to be judged by you, or by man's day; but neither do I judge my own self.
1 Corinthians__04.4: For I am not conscious to myself of any thing, yet am I not hereby justified; but he that judgeth me, is the Lord.
1 Corinthians__04.5: Therefore judge not before the time; until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts; and then shall every man have praise from God.
1 Corinthians__04.6: But these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and to Apollo, for your sakes; that in us you may learn, that one be not puffed up against the other for another, above that which is written.
1 Corinthians__04.7: For who distinguisheth thee? Or what hast thou that thou hast not received? And if thou hast received, why dost thou glory, as if thou hadst not received it?
1 Corinthians__04.8: You are now full; you are now become rich; you reign without us; and I would to God you did reign, that we also might reign with you.
1 Corinthians__04.9: For I think that God hath set forth us apostles, the last, as it were men appointed to death: we are made a spectacle to the world, and to angels, and to men.
1 Corinthians__04.10: We are fools for Christ's sake, but you are wise in Christ; we are weak, but you are strong; you are honourable, but we without honour.
1 Corinthians__04.11: Even unto this hour we both hunger and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted, and have no fixed abode;
1 Corinthians__04.12: And we labour, working with our own hands: we are reviled, and we bless; we are persecuted, and we suffer it.
1 Corinthians__04.13: We are blasphemed, and we entreat; we are made as the refuse of this world, the offscouring of all even until now.
1 Corinthians__04.14: I write not these things to confound you; but I admonish you as my dearest children.
1 Corinthians__04.15: For if you have ten thousand instructors in Christ, yet not many fathers. For in Christ Jesus, by the gospel, I have begotten you.
1 Corinthians__04.16: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me, as I also am of Christ.
1 Corinthians__04.17: For this cause have I sent to you Timothy, who is my dearest son and faithful in the Lord; who will put you in mind of my ways, which are in Christ Jesus; as I teach everywhere in every church.
1 Corinthians__04.18: As if I would not come to you, so some are puffed up.
1 Corinthians__04.19: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord will: and will know, not the speech of them that are puffed up, but the power.
1 Corinthians__04.20: For the kingdom of God is not in speech, but in power.
1 Corinthians__04.21: What will you? shall I come to you with a rod; or in charity, and in the spirit of meekness?
